critique: This executive order establishes a revolving fund for the Works Progress Administration (WPA) during the Great Depression. It seems to be focused on economic relief and government intervention to stimulate the economy. There's no direct impact on immigration, civil liberties, or social inclusion. It delegates authority to the Administrator of the WPA, subject to presidential approval, which doesn't drastically alter the balance of executive power. It also involves state-level administration, suggesting a cooperative federalism approach. Given the context of the New Deal era, the order leans towards liberal economic policies.
